definition[0]: the joining together of two or more companies or organizations to form one larger one
example[1]: a proposed merger between two of the largest software companies
example[2]: There has been a lot of talk about a merger with another leading bank.
definition[1]: an occasion when two or more companies, organizations etc join together to form a larger company etc
example[3]: The two airlines ended merger talks (=discussions about the possibility of merging) after failing to agree on how much of the combined company each side would own.
example[4]: The merger proposal calls for the three companies to be combined into a new entity.
example[5]: the terms of the merger agreement
example[6]: The merger frenzy (=when a lot of mergers are taking place) has helped push up cable valuations to record highs on Wall Street.
example[7]: A merger between similar banks in the same area should enable them to eliminate 40% of the expenses of one of the banks.
